basics.name: Jay (Zhuosheng) Liu
basics.label: 2026 graduate seeking internship/full-time opportunities in DS/MLE
basics.summary: PhD in Microbiology (UC Davis), dual Master's in Computer Science and Biotechnology. Research focus: Exploratory Data Science, Applied ML/AI, AI4Science.

work.name: Capital One
work.summary: Working with the AI Foundation Customer Core team on Graph Representation Learning across multiple modalities of customer data to predict and identify targeted prospective users and prevent potential fraud suspects.
highlights: Investigated graph embedding methods (Cube, Node2Vec, Graph Autoencoder, Variational Graph Autoencoder) to predict future shared accounts among 2M customers, achieving 73% boost of AUC score

work.name: Metagenomi Inc
work.summary: Conducted data preprocessing and feature engineering using highly noisy and high-dimensional data from in-house PostgreSQL database. Assisted in development of ML and deep learning models for CRISPR nuclease indel and gene editing outcome prediction.
highlights: Improved predictive model accuracy; helped reduce operational cost by approximately 40%
Random Forest Regressor achieving 88.0% cosine similarity for indel profile prediction
CNN, LSTM achieving 99.5% accuracy for gene editing outcome prediction

work.name: Information Fusion and Mining Lab, UC Davis
work.position: Graduate Research Assistant (co-advised by Dr. Jiawei Zhang)
work.summary: Advanced solutions on parameter efficient fine-tuning for vision-language models. Systematical evaluation of GenAI text-to-video and image-to-video models.
highlights: Compared parameter efficient fine-tuning methods for vision-language models

publications.name: Pathogenic potential prediction of Vibrio parahaemolyticus by using pangenome data with high performance machine learning algorithms
A Survey of AI-Generated Video Evaluation
AIGVE-Tool: AI-Generated Video Evaluation Toolkit with Multifaceted Benchmark
Recent advances in understanding the fitness and survival mechanisms of Vibrio parahaemolyticus

projects.name: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning for Vision-Language Models
projects.summary: Extensive study on PEFT methods applied to vision-language models (e.g., CLIP). Comprehensive empirical analysis across datasets such as VTAB-1K. Investigated CoOP, VPT, UPT and hyperparameter optimization.

projects.name: Utilizing Efficient Segment-Anything Model (ESAM) for Enhanced Biomedical Image Segmentation
projects.summary: Implemented ESAM for complex biomedical image segmentation using box and point prompts. Developed Python-based framework with GPT-4 for medical recommendations. Statistical evaluation using IoU and DSC on 1500+ medical images.

projects.name: Virulence prediction of pathogenic foodborne pathogens using ML/DL based on Pangenome
projects.summary: Constructed pangenome (100,000+ unique gene features) with Snakemake pipeline. Trained ML/DL models (Kmean, GMM, KNN, SVM, RF, Naive Bayes, MLP, CNN); achieved 93% virulence prediction accuracy. Interpretable CNN with Grad-CAM for biological insights.

items: Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS) (Reviewer)
ACM Transactions on Computing for Healthcare (Reviewer)
IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics (Reviewer)
IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems (Reviewer)
